algorithm_technique: Iterate through divisors of the array length 'n' to find special indices, then sum their squares.
problem_summary_simple: Sum the squares of elements at indices that divide the array's length.
problem_summary_technical: For a 1-indexed array nums of length n, sum nums[i]^2 where i divides n.
key_insights: The problem defines 'special' elements based on index divisibility.
Iterating up to the square root of 'n' efficiently finds all divisors.
Handle the case where a divisor 'i' and 'n/i' are the same to avoid double counting.
